title: Morarji Desai
summary: Morarji Ranchhodji Desai[1] (29 February 1896 â€“ 10 April 1995)[2] was an Indian independence activist and politician who served as the 4th Prime Minister of India between 1977 and 1979 leading the government formed by the Janata Party. During his long career in politics, he held many important posts in government such as Chief Minister of Bombay State, Home Minister, Finance Minister and 2nd Deputy Prime Minister of India.
